briefdescription.para: Also need to protect the aliased file name.
for reporting after task is complete. Only for display use.
the ODTask needs to know where this blockfile lies in the track, so for convenience, we have this here.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a PCMAliasBlockFile, writing the summary to disk.

memberdef.name: ODPCMAliasBlockFile

briefdescription.para: summaryAvailable should be true if the file has been written already.
Returns TRUE if this block's complete summary has been computed and is ready (for OD)
Returns TRUE if the summary has not yet been written, but is actively being computed and written to disk.

memberdef.name: GetMinMax

briefdescription.para: Gets extreme values for the specified region.
Gets extreme values for the entire block.
Returns the 256 byte summary data block.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the 256 byte summary data block. Clients should check to see if the summary is available before trying to read it with this call.

briefdescription.para: Returns the 64K summary data block.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the 64K summary data block. Clients should check to see if the summary is available before trying to read it with this call.

briefdescription.para: Makes NEW ODPCMAliasBlockFile or PCMAliasBlockFile depending on summary availability.

detaileddescription.para:
If the summary has been computed, Construct a NEW PCMAliasBlockFile based on this one. otherwise construct an ODPCMAliasBlockFile that still needs to be computed.
newFileName
The filename to copy the summary data to.

briefdescription.para: Saves as xml ODPCMAliasBlockFile or PCMAliasBlockFile depending on summary availability.

detaileddescription.para: Writes the xml as a PCMAliasBlockFile if we can (if we have a summary file) Otherwise writes XML as a subset of attributes with 'odpcmaliasblockfile as the start tag. Most notably, the summaryfile attribute refers to a file that does not yet, so when the project file is read back in and this object reconstructed, it needs to avoid trying to open it as well as schedule itself for OD loading

briefdescription.para: Writes the summary file if summary data is available.
A public interface to WriteSummary.

detaileddescription.para: Calls write summary, and makes sure it is only done once in a thread-safe fashion.

briefdescription.para: Sets the value that indicates where the first sample in this block corresponds to the global sequence/clip. Only for display use.
Gets the value that indicates where the first sample in this block corresponds to the global sequence/clip. Only for display use.
Locks the blockfile only if it has a file that exists.

detaileddescription.para: Locks the blockfile only if it has a file that exists. This needs to be done so that the unsaved ODPCMAliasBlockfiles are deleted upon exit

briefdescription.para: Unlocks the blockfile only if it has a file that exists.

detaileddescription.para: unlocks the blockfile only if it has a file that exists. This needs to be done so that the unsaved ODPCMAliasBlockfiles are deleted upon exit

briefdescription.para: sets the amount of samples the clip associated with this blockfile is offset in the wavetrack (non effecting)
Gets the number of samples the clip associated with this blockfile is offset by.

memberdef.argsstring: (samplePtr data, sampleFormat format, sampleCount start, sampleCount len) override
memberdef.name: ReadData

briefdescription.para: Reads the specified data from the aliased file using libsndfile.

detaileddescription.para: Reads the specified data from the aliased file, using libsndfile, and converts it to the given sample format. Copied from PCMAliasBlockFIle but wxLog calls taken out for thread safety

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to read the sample data into.
The format to convert the data into
The offset within the block to begin reading
The number of samples to read

briefdescription.para: Read the summary into a buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Read the summary of this alias block from disk. Since the audio data is elsewhere, this consists of reading the entire summary file.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer where the summary data will be stored. It must be at least mSummaryInfo.totalSummaryBytes long.

briefdescription.para: sets the file name the summary info will be saved in. threadsafe.
sets the file name the summary info will be saved in. threadsafe.

detaileddescription.para: when the project closes, it locks the blockfiles. Override this in case it needs special treatment

briefdescription.para: Prevents a read on other threads.
Allows reading on other threads.
Reconstructs from XML a ODPCMAliasBlockFile and reschedules it for OD loading.

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a ODPCMAliasBlockFile from the xml output of WriteXML. Does not schedule the ODPCMAliasBlockFile for OD loading. Client code must do this.

briefdescription.para: Write the summary to disk, using the derived ReadData() to get the data.

memberdef.argsstring: (samplePtr buffer, sampleCount len, sampleFormat format) override
memberdef.name: CalcSummary

detaileddescription.para: A thread-safe version of CalcSummary. BlockFile::CalcSummary uses a static summary array across the class, which we can't use. Get a buffer containing a summary block describing this sample data. This must be called by derived classes when they are constructed, to allow them to construct their summary data, after which they should write that data to their disk file.
This method also has the side effect of setting the mMin, mMax, and mRMS members of this class.
Unlike BlockFile's implementation You SHOULD DELETE the returned buffer. this is protected so it shouldn't be hard to deal with - just override all BlockFile methods that use this method.

parameterdescription.para: A buffer containing the sample data to be analyzed
The length of the sample data
The format of the sample data.

detaileddescription.para: Increases the reference count of this block by one. Only DirManager should call this method. This method has been overidden to be threadsafe. It is important especially if two blockfiles deref at the same time resulting in a double deletion of the file
Decreases the reference count of this block by one. If this causes the count to become zero, deletes the associated disk file and deletes this object

briefdescription.para: An AliasBlockFile that references uncompressed data in an existing file.

detaileddescription.para: ODPCMAliasBlockFile is a special type of PCMAliasBlockFile that does not necessarily have summary data available The summary is eventually computed and written to a file in a background thread.
Load On-Demand implementation of the AliasBlockFile for PCM files.

to load large files more quickly, we take skip computing the summary data and put ODPCMAliasBlockFiles in the sequence as place holders. A background thread loads and computes the summary data into these classes. ODPCMAliasBlockFiles are unlike all other BlockFiles are not immutable (for the most part,) because when NEW summary data is computed for an existing ODPCMAliasBlockFile we save the buffer then and write the Summary File.
All BlockFile methods that treat the summary data as a buffer that exists in its BlockFile are implemented here to behave when the data is not available yet.
Some of these methods have been overridden only because they used the unsafe wxLog calls in the base class.
